text: to india now where politicians are
appealing for calm following the murder
of a hindu shopkeeper by two muslim men
in the northern state of rajasthan the
men filmed the attack and posted the
footage on social media they claimed it
was in retaliation because they said the
victim appeared to support controversial
remarks made by a politician about the
prophet muhammad our correspondent
shivastava is in the city of udapu where
the killing happened
the killing which is not just stunned
and shaken the state of rajasthan but
the entire country happened in this very
lane almost 10 shops down the line
this is the center of the city where
both hindus and muslims have been living
together for centuries but never ever
has such an incident happened before now
the area is completely fortified
heavy police presence can be seen
everywhere and authorities are not
really willing to give details of
how
the people who have been accused of this
crime are being questioned what is
coming out of the investigation
one thing is very clear that the society
out here is completely divided along
religious lines after this gruesome
killing
are staying in a country which is
heavily populated by hindus
so this shouldn't have happened
i would request prime minister modi to
look into the matter so that it does not
happen again
what's really striking is that not many
are forthcoming to come out and speak to
us about the exact nature of the
violence which happened after the
killing
people out here say that something like
this has never happened there have been
communal caches before there have been
incidents of stone pelting and tensions
between hindus and muslims but never has
somebody's life being taken
and that is the sense that we get in
this old city area

this is the place which saw
